g.G575: "off," i.e. away (from something near), in various senses (of place, time, or relation; literal or figurative)
g.G2316: figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very
g.G5037: both or also (properly, as correlation of G2532 (καί))
g.G1343: equity (of character or act); specially (Christian) justification
g.G2532: and, also, even, so then, too, etc.; often used in connection (or composition) with other particles or small words
g.G38: properly, purification, i.e. (the state) purity; concretely (by Hebraism) a purifier
g.G629: (the act) ransom in full, i.e. (figuratively) riddance, or (specially) Christian salvation

g.G2443: compare G3588 (ὁ)); in order that (denoting the purpose or the result)
g.G1125: to "grave", especially to write; figuratively, to describe
g.G3588: the (sometimes to be supplied, at others omitted, in English idiom)
g.G2744: to vaunt (in a good or a bad sense)
g.G2962: supreme in authority, i.e. (as noun) controller; by implication, Master (as a respectful title)
